doc.after: Following the limited service of the only Soviet-designed four-engined heavy bomber, the Petlyakov Pe-8 with the VVS starting in 1940, of which only some 93 examples were ever built, during 1944 and 1945 five B-29s made emergency landings in Soviet territory after bombing raids on Japanese Manchuria and Japan. In accordance with Soviet neutrality in the Pacific War, the bombers were interned and kept by the Soviets, despite American requests for their return and were, instead, used by the Soviets as a pattern for the Tupolev Tu-4.[51]
